funnel.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a thin tube with a wide top that you use for pouring liquid into a container with a narrow opening, such as a bottle
funnel.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a metal chimney that allows smoke from a steam engine or steamship to get out
funnel.translation[1].definitions[0].def: if you funnel something somewhere, or if it funnels there, it goes there by passing through a narrow opening
funnel.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Police at the barriers funnelled the crowd into the arena.
Incoming tides funnel up the channel with enormous power.
funnel.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to send money, information etc from various places to someone
funnel.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: His office funneled millions of dollars in secret contributions to the re-election campaign.
